mdRecord.dcterms:title: Chapel of Saint Peter and Saint Paul, interior
Chapel of St. Peter and St. Paul
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Vaughan, Henry (American architect, 1845-1917) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Constructed between 1886-1891, the original design and building was by Henry Vaughn, and represents one of the earliest church buildings in America in the Gothic style. The Chapel was consecrated on June 5, 1888, by Bishop Niles of New Hampshire. The tower, from Vaughnâ€™s original design, was added in 1894. the . In 1898 the recumbent funeral effigy of first Rector, the Reverend Dr. Henry Augustus Coit was added to the sanctuary. In 1928, the noted architect Ralph Adams Cram was charged with enlarging the Chapel to accommodate a growing school, and the building was cut in two, the altar sanctuary moved eastward, and two bays of windows added in the choir section. This same period saw the construction, also under Cram, of the north porch behind the pulpit, the chantry, and the War Memorial. http://www.sps.edu/podium/default.aspx?t=126957 [work]
